text: - Red is our color.

Our bodies produce
2 million red blood
cells every single second.

Red has marked us out
since the very beginning.

Many creation myths claim
that the first humans
were made from red earth.

The name "Adam" is derived
from the Hebrew word for "red."

Some of our earliest artworks
were made from red pigments.

The most famous is
cochineal, which

comes from the dried
bodies of insects.

Humans are some of the only
mammals who can see red.
Dogs can't see it, nor can cats.

And despite all those
red rags we wave at them,
neither can bulls.

Red appears in more than
70% of national flags
and on billions of lips.

But it also stops
us in our tracks,

because red has a powerful
effect on our brains.

Scientific studies have found
that it makes us stronger,
more alert, more competitive.

And it even makes us more
attractive to each other.
[music playing]
